product.title: Imageshack, MEGAUPLOAD & Photobucket Uploader
product.description: This will enable you to host your images/files on Imageshack, MEGAUPLOAD or Photobucket directly from within your post editor.
product.svn: Imageshack, MEGAUPLOAD & Photobucket Uploader v3.8.005: $Author: mosh $, $Date: 2009-11-06 13:39:28 +1100 (Fri, 06 Nov 2009) $, $Rev: 81 $

phrasetype.name: Postbit
phrasetype.phrase: Hide the upload form from Photobucket
Display the upload form from Photobucket

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Specify the text color of the Imageshack iFrame. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the height of the Imageshack iFrame.

Specify the size of the Imageshack upload input field (between 1 and 99). This is where the path to the file you want to upload is manually entered or browsed. You will have to adjust the iFrame Width field below if number of charachers you specify cut off the Browse... button.
Specify the width of the Imageshack iFrame.
The colour of the embedded MEGAUPLOAD box to be displayed.
Only change the license key value here if this a Premium account, otherwise, leave the key value as it is.
The size of the embedded MEGAUPLOAD box to be displayed.
Specify the background color of the Photobucket iFrame. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the text color of the Photobucket iFrame. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the color of the Display Text. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the color of the Display Text when hovered. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the height of the Photobucket iFrame.
Specify the link color of the Photobucket iFrame. This needs to be a valid 6 digit hexadecimal number between 000000 (black) and FFFFFF (white).
Specify the width of the Photobucket iFrame.
